statement: Landmark legal ruling finds that covid tests are not fit for purpose .
label: SUPPORTED
evidences: It showed that if someone tested positive for Covid at a cycle threshold of 35 or higher, the chances of that person actually being infected is less than three percent, and that " the probability of receiving a false positive is 97% or higher."
And it is not the only country whose institutions are clashing with received wisdom on Covid.

Read more Immunity for YEARS or DECADES: Covid resistance may last much longer than previously thought, says new research They were also scathing about the reliability of the PCR (polymerase chain reaction) test, the most commonly used check for Covid.
The implication was that the results could not be trusted.
In the eyes of this court, then, a positive test does not correspond to a Covid case.
explanation: The evidence provides information from a legal ruling that questions the reliability of PCR tests for COVID-19, emphasizing a high probability of false positives at certain cycle thresholds. This supports the claim that there was a judgment related to COVID tests being unfit for purpose.

statement: Trump just banned all travel from europe to stop coronavirus
label: SUPPORTED
evidences: ET Thursday President Trump announced a 30-day ban on travel from European countries to the United States, beginning on Friday at midnight, in a bid "to keep new cases" of coronavirus "from entering our shores."

VIDEO0:3300:33 President Trump suspends all travel from Europe for 30 days Coronavirus WASHINGTON  President Donald Trump announced that a ban on travelers to the United States from Europe would be in place for the next 30 days, in an attempt to stem the spread of the coronavirus pandemic.

Advertisement In a statement after Trump's address, DHS said Trump had signed a proclamation that "suspends the entry of most foreign nationals who have been in certain European countries at any point during the 14 days prior to their scheduled arrival to the United States."
"We will be suspending all travel from Europe to the United States for the next 30 days," Trump said, blasting coronavirus as "a foreign virus."

Advertisement Trump's travel ban from Europe follows a massive outbreak in Italy that's resulted in a nationwide lockdown in which businesses have been shuttered and travel severely curtailed in the southern-European country.
explanation: The claim states that Trump banned all travel from Europe to stop coronavirus, but the evidence specifies exemptions. The ban excludes U.S. citizens and permanent residents returning from Europe, as well as limitations for travelers not from 'certain European countries.' Therefore, it is not a total ban.

statement: Functional sars-cov-2-specific immune memory persists after mild covid-19
label: SUPPORTED
evidences: Furthermore, the SARS-CoV-2-specific memory lymphocytes exhibited characteristics associated with potent antiviral immunity: memory T cells secreted IFN-γ and expanded upon antigen re-encounter, while memory B cells expressed receptors capable of neutralizing virus when expressed as antibodies.

statement: Remdesivir and chloroquine effectively inhibit the recently emerged novel coronavirus in vitro
label: SUPPORTED
evidences: Remdesivir has been recently recognized as a promising antiviral drug against a wide array of RNA viruses (including SARS/MERS-CoV5) infection in cultured cells, mice and nonhuman primate (NHP) models.
Remdesivir and chloroquine effectively inhibit the recently emerged novel coronavirus (2019-nCoV) in vitro.

S2) showed that remdesivir also inhibited virus infection efficiently in a human cell line (human liver cancer Huh-7 cells), which is sensitive to 2019-nCoV.2 Chloroquine, a widely-used anti-malarial and autoimmune disease drug, has recently been reported as a potential broad-spectrum antiviral drug.8,9 Chloroquine is known to block virus infection by increasing endosomal pH required for virus/cell fusion, as well as interfering with the glycosylation of cellular receptors of SARS-CoV.10 Our time-of-addition assay demonstrated that chloroquine functioned at both entry, and at post-entry stages of the 2019-nCoV infection in Vero E6 cells (Fig.

Notably, two compounds remdesivir (EC50 = 0.77 μM; CC50 > 100 μM; SI > 129.87) and chloroquine (EC50 = 1.13 μM; CC50 > 100 μM, SI > 88.50) potently blocked virus infection at low-micromolar concentration and showed high SI (Fig.
explanation: The evidence explicitly states that remdesivir and chloroquine effectively inhibit the novel coronavirus (2019-nCoV) in vitro, with supporting experimental data (e.g., EC50 values) and details about their mechanisms of action (e.g., chloroquine's effect on endosomal pH and glycosylation).

statement: Washington state group is 1st to sue fox new for calling the coronavirus a hoax
label: SUPPORTED
evidences: According to the suit, Fox News violated the CPA by falsely and deceptively disseminating News via cable news contracts that the coronavirus was a hoax, and that it was otherwise not a danger to public health and safety. At least one poll has found that Fox News viewers were less likely to take precautions against the virus (including social distancing, handwashing, and other measures) seriously, and an open letter to Fox News from a group of journalism professors said misinformation that reaches the Fox News audience is a danger to public health. Based on the statements made, and the subsequent departure of Trish Regan, WASHLITE does present a cognizable theory of liability.

I said it was a hoax for them to be using it as a bludgeon on Trump. Notably, he made this denial in response to criticism from 74 journalism professors who wrote an open letter to Fox claiming that coverage of the coronavirus from Fox News Channel "is a danger to public health."

But when you get to the point where you are endangering the community  that transcends the limits of the First Amendment. When reached by phone for comment, Catherine Clark, a Seattle attorney who volunteered to join the plaintiffs legal team after reading an initial news account, said this is a case of national importance. A supporter of First Amendment protections, she continued, When it comes to the public health, safety, and welfare, it seems to me a different set of rules apply. In a statement, Fox News general counsel Lily Fu Clafee responded to the suit by saying: Wrong on the facts, frivolous on the law.
explanation: The evidence indicates that WASHLITE, a Washington state group, filed a lawsuit against Fox News alleging the network called the coronavirus a hoax. This aligns with the claim, as the lawsuit directly addresses Fox News' handling of misinformation and its impact on public health, including quotes and context supporting the accusation. While Fox News denies the allegations, the existence of the lawsuit itself supports the claim.

statement: Unfounded fears that dogs can spread covid-19 can cause harm
label: SUPPORTED
evidences: And, although no evidence exists to indicate that they can either transmit the virus or develop its associated coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19), fear among the public that pets might play a role in spreading COVID-19 has resulted in pets being abandoned or even killed.
At this time, there is no evidence that companion animals play a significant role in spreading the virus that causes COVID-19; however, we are still learning about this virus.

According to the World Organisation for Animal Health (OIE), there is no justification in taking measures against companion animals that may compromise their welfare, such as harming them, abandoning them, or euthanizing them based on unfounded fears over COVID-19.
explanation: The evidence confirms that there is no substantial proof that dogs can transmit COVID-19, but it highlights that public fear based on these unfounded concerns has led to harm, such as abandonment or euthanasia of pets. This supports the claim.

evidences: Almost two decades after it first launched, the uniquely decentralized structure of Folding@home is bringing together more people and computing power than ever to help understand, and hopefully fight, the COVID-19 threat.

Users around the world have donated processing power of over one million personal computers to help Folding@Homea distributed computing project for simulating protein dynamicsto search for new therapies for the coronavirus.
explanation: The evidence states that over 1 million personal computers have donated processing power to the Folding@home project to help fight COVID-19. This directly supports the claim.

statement: Inactivating porcine coronavirus before nuclei acid isolation with the temperature higher than 56 °c damages its genome integrity seriously
label: SUPPORTED
evidences: Our results showed that only 50.11% of the detectable viral templates left after the inactivation of 56 °C for 30 minutes and only 3.36% left after the inactivation of 92 °C for 5 minutes when the samples were preserved by Hanks solution, one of an isotonic salt solutions currently suggested.

According to The Laboratory Technical Guidelines for Detection 2019-nCoV (Fourth Edition) issued by National Health and Commission of China and The Experts Consensus on Nucleic Acid Detection of 2019-nCoV released by Chinese Society of Laboratory Medicine, the human samples must be placed under 56°C or higher to inactivate the viruses in order to keep the inspectors from virus infection before the nucleic acids were isolated as the template of qRT-PCR.

We therefore highly recommend to carry out systematic investigation on the impact of high temperature inactivation on the integrity of 2019-nCoV genome and develop a sample preservation solution to protect the detectable templates of 2019-nCoV nucleic acids from high temperature inactivation damage.

However, the detectable templates of viral nucleic acids can be unchanged after the samples were incubated at 56 °C or higher if the samples were preserved with an optimized solution to protect the RNA from being disrupted.
explanation: The evidence indicates that inactivating porcine coronavirus at temperatures above 56 °C damages its genome integrity significantly, with measurable reductions in detectable viral templates observed at both 56 °C and higher temperatures. The evidence also clarifies that optimized solutions can mitigate this damage, but without such preservation measures, the claim holds true.

statement: Therapeutic anticoagulation is associated with decreased mortality in mechanically ventilated covid-19 patients
label: SUPPORTED
evidences: A multivariate Cox proportional hazard regression model with PS weights to adjust for baseline differences found a 79% reduction in death in patients who were therapeutically anticoagulated HR 0.209, [95% Cl (0.10, 0.46), p < 0.001].

Results Propensity score (PS) weighted Kaplan-Meier plot demonstrated a survival advantage (57% vs. 25%) at 35 days from admission to the ICU in patients who received therapeutic anticoagulation for a minimum of 5 days compared to those who received prophylactic anticoagulation during their hospital course.
Conclusions Therapeutic anticoagulation is associated with a survival advantage among patients with COVID-19 who require mechanical ventilation in the ICU.
explanation: The evidence demonstrates a survival advantage associated with therapeutic anticoagulation in mechanically ventilated COVID-19 patients based on statistical analysis, including a multivariate Cox proportional hazard regression and propensity score weighted Kaplan-Meier plot. This supports the claim.

statement: Sars-cov-2 is an unrestricted bioweapon
label: SUPPORTED
evidences: It also strengthens our earlier assertion that SARS-CoV-2 is a product of laboratory modification, which can be created in approximately six months using a template virus owned by a laboratory of the People's Liberation Army (PLA).
We therefore define SARS- CoV-2 as an Unrestricted Bioweapon and the current pandemic a result of Unrestricted Biowarfare.
Importantly, while SARS-CoV-2 meets the criteria of a bioweapon specified by the PLA, its impact is well beyond what is conceived for a typical bioweapon.
explanation: The evidence provided defines SARS-CoV-2 as an 'Unrestricted Bioweapon' and claims it is a result of 'Unrestricted Biowarfare,' but this is an assertion made without conclusive scientific backing or widespread validation in the scientific community. The claim is presented as an opinion or hypothesis rather than a verified fact.

statement: Mosaic rbd nanoparticles elicit neutralizing antibodies against sars-cov-2 and zoonotic coronaviruses
label: SUPPORTED
evidences: Mice immunized with RBD-nanoparticles, but not soluble antigen, elicited cross-reactive antibody binding and neutralization responses, confirming increased immunogenicity from multimerization.

Mosaic-RBD-nanoparticles elicited antibodies with superior cross-reactive recognition of heterologous RBDs compared to sera from immunizations with homotypic SARS-CoV-2RBD-nanoparticles or antibodies from COVID-19 convalescent human plasmas.
Thus, a single immunization with mosaic-RBD- nanoparticles provides a potential strategy to simultaneously protect against SARS-CoV-2 and emerging zoonotic coronaviruses.
explanation: The evidence indicates that mosaic-RBD nanoparticles elicit neutralizing antibodies that have superior cross-reactive recognition compared to other methods. This supports the claim that they provide a strategy for protection against SARS-CoV-2 and zoonotic coronaviruses.

statement: South korean city deserted due to super spreading event
label: SUPPORTED
evidences: The deserted shopping malls and cinemas of Daegu, a city of 2.5 million people, became one of the most striking images outside China of an outbreak that international authorities are trying to prevent from spreading into a global pandemic.

The deserted shopping malls and cinemas of Daegu, a city of 2.5 million people, became one of the most striking images outside China of an outbreak that international authorities are trying stop from becoming a global pandemic.

Updated: 20 Feb 2020, 06:04 PM IST Hyonhee Shin , Ryan Woo , AP The deserted shopping malls and cinemas of Daegu, a city of 2.5 million people, became one of the most striking images outside China of an outbreak that international authorities are trying to prevent from spreading into a global pandemic Share Via Read Full Story SEOUL/BEIJING : The streets of South Korea's fourth-largest city were abandoned on Thursday, with residents holed up indoors after dozens of people caught the coronavirus in what the authorities described as a "super-spreading event" at a church.
South Korea's Centers for Disease Control and Prevention described the outbreak there as a "super-spreading event".
Korea's Centers for Disease Control and Prevention described the outbreak there as a "super-spreading event".
explanation: The evidence confirms that Daegu, a South Korean city, became deserted due to a super-spreading event linked to a church congregation, as described by the Korea Centers for Disease Control and Prevention. The claim aligns with the information in the evidence.

Updated: 20 Feb 2020, 06:04 PM IST Hyonhee Shin , Ryan Woo , AP The deserted shopping malls and cinemas of Daegu, a city of 2.5 million people, became one of the most striking images outside China of an outbreak that international authorities are trying to prevent from spreading into a global pandemic Share Via Read Full Story SEOUL/BEIJING : The streets of South Korea's fourth-largest city were abandoned on Thursday, with residents holed up indoors after dozens of people caught the coronavirus in what the authorities described as a "super-spreading event" at a church.
South Korea's Centers for Disease Control and Prevention described the outbreak there as a "super-spreading event".
Korea's Centers for Disease Control and Prevention described the outbreak there as a "super-spreading event".

statement: Performance of vivadiagtm covid-19 igm/igg rapid test is inadequate for diagnosis of covid-19 in acute patients referring to emergency room department
label: SUPPORTED
evidences: On the basis of our results, VivaDiag COVID19 IgM/IgG Rapid Test LFIA is not recommended for triage of patients with suspected COVID19.

Indeed, the majority of patients that tested positive for COVID19 by realtime RTPCR would have been identified as negative using only the rapid serological assay, leading to a misdiagnosis of COVID19 disease in the vast majority of patients.

Such low sensitivity leads to non-diagnosis of most patients, which is why the authors do not recommend the use of the COVID-19 IgM/IgG VivaDiagTM rapid test for triage of patients with suspected COVID-19 in emergency department.

statement: Cetylpyridinium chloride-containing mouthwashes reduce in vitro sars-cov-2 infectivity.
label: SUPPORTED
evidences: A common compound in mouthwashes found to inhibit SARS-CoV-2 in vitro.
CPC- containing mouth rinses could represent a cost-effective measure to reduce SARS-CoV-2 infectivity in saliva, aiding to reduce viral transmission from infected individuals.
Here we show that Cetylpyridinium chloride (CPC), a quaternary ammonium compound present in many oral mouthwashes, reduces SARS-CoV-2 infectivity by inhibiting viral fusion with target cells.
"A common compound in mouthwashes found to inhibit SARS- CoV-2 in vitro".
Antiviral activity of CPC-containing mouthwashes inhibiting SARS-CoV-2 entry.
explanation: The evidence confirms that Cetylpyridinium chloride (CPC), present in mouthwashes, reduces SARS-CoV-2 infectivity in vitro by inhibiting viral fusion with target cells. Multiple statements directly support the claim of CPC-containing mouthwashes reducing in vitro SARS-CoV-2 infectivity.

statement: Symptom-based screening process was ineffective in detecting sars-cov-2 infection during evacuation of 126 people from wuhan , china .
label: SUPPORTED
evidences: In fact, the researchers noted "epidemiologic uncertainty regarding possible transmission of the virus by asymptomatic or subclinically symptomatic infected persons" and that it is also not clear "whether persons who show no signs or symptoms of respiratory infections shed SARS-CoV2."

Aside from the ineffectiveness of the screening process, the authors found that the virus could potentially be spread by those who exhibited mild symptoms: Shedding of potentially infectious virus may occur in persons who have no fever and no signs or only minor signs of infection. Over 73,000 people around the world have been infected with the coronavirus, most of those cases in mainland China.
Nevertheless, the researchers concluded that the symptom-based screening process was "ineffective" at detecting cases of SARS-CoV2 infection.

In this effort to evacuate 126 people from Wuhan to Frankfurt, a symptom-based screening process was ineffective in detecting SARS-CoV-2 infection in 2 persons who later were found to have evidence of SARS-CoV-2 in a throat swab.
explanation: The evidence directly mentions that the researchers concluded the symptom-based screening process was ineffective at detecting SARS-CoV-2 infection, including specific examples where individuals evading detection were later found positive via throat swabs.

statement: Saliva is more sensitive for sars-cov-2 detection in covid-19 patients than nasopharyngeal swabs
label: SUPPORTED
evidences: Saliva is a promising candidate for SARS-CoV-2 diagnostics because (1) collection is minimally invasive and can reliably be self-administered and (2) saliva has exhibited comparable sensitivity to nasopharyngeal swabs in detection of other respiratory pathogens, including endemic human coronaviruses, in previous studies.

When we compared SARS-CoV-2 detection from patient-matched nasopharyngeal and saliva samples, we found that saliva yielded greater detection sensitivity and consistency throughout the course of infection.

Taken together, our findings demonstrate that saliva is a viable and more sensitive alternative to nasopharyngeal swabs and could enable at-home self-administered sample collection for accurate large- scale SARS-CoV-2 testing.

To validate the use of saliva for SARS-CoV-2 detection, we tested nasopharyngeal and saliva samples from confirmed COVID-19 patients and self-collected samples from healthcare workers on COVID-19 wards.
explanation: The evidence explicitly states that saliva yielded greater detection sensitivity and consistency compared to nasopharyngeal swabs for SARS-CoV-2 detection in COVID-19 patients. The findings also validate saliva as a viable and more sensitive alternative, providing direct support for the claim.

statement: Vitamin d sufficiency reduced risk for morbidity and mortality in covid-19 patients
label: SUPPORTED

Conclusion: Therefore, it is recommended that improving vitamin D status in the general population and in particular hospitalized patients has a potential benefit in reducing the severity of morbidities and mortality associated with acquiring COVID-19.

Conclusion: Therefore, it is recommended that improving vitamin D status in the general population and in particular hospitalized patients has a potential benefit in reducing the severity of morbidities and mortality associated with acquiring COVID-19.

statement: A functional genomics approach to understand host genetic regulation of covid-19 severity
label: SUPPORTED
evidences: A functional genomics investigation based on functional characterization of individuals with high genetic risk for severe COVID-19 susceptibility identified several major patterns: i. a large impact of genetically determined innate immune responses in COVID-19, with increased susceptibility for severe disease in individuals with defective monocyte-derived cytokine production; ii.

Here, we employed the detailed clinical, immunological and multi-omics data of the Human Functional Genomics Projects (HFGP) to explore the physiological significance of the host genetic variants that influence susceptibility to severe COVID-19.
Our findings allow a physiological understanding of genetic susceptibility to severe COVID-19, and indicate pathways that could be targeted for prevention and therapy.
explanation: The evidence mentions using a functional genomics approach to understand genetic regulation of COVID-19 severity, specifically exploring host genetic variants influencing susceptibility to severe cases. It aligns well with the claim.

statement: Strong link found between abnormal liver tests and poor covid-19 outcomes
label: SUPPORTED
evidences: Rather than the liver itself driving poorer outcomes in COVID-19 patients, the organ is more likely a bystander affected by the hyperinflammation associated with COVID-19 and by the side effects of related treatments, Nathanson said.

But regardless of whether patients came to the hospital with existing liver problems or developed them during their COVID-19-related hospitalization, a strong association was observed between abnormal liver tests and the severity of the COVID-19 cases, the researchers said.
The study noted a relationship between drugs used to treat severe COVID-19 and liver damage, most significantly the drug tocilizumab.

We observed a strong association between the use of COVID-19 medications and abnormal liver tests, said Lim, but added that they could not confidently tease out that the abnormal tests were due to drug-induced liver injury as opposed to the disease.
explanation: The evidence indicates a strong association between abnormal liver tests and the severity of COVID-19 cases, supporting the claim. While the liver issues may not directly drive poor outcomes, they are strongly linked to hyperinflammation, treatment side effects, and disease severity.

label: NOT_SUPPORTED
evidences: Rather than the liver itself driving poorer outcomes in COVID-19 patients, the organ is more likely a bystander affected by the hyperinflammation associated with COVID-19 and by the side effects of related treatments, Nathanson said.

But regardless of whether patients came to the hospital with existing liver problems or developed them during their COVID-19-related hospitalization, a strong association was observed between abnormal liver tests and the severity of the COVID-19 cases, the researchers said.
The study noted a relationship between drugs used to treat severe COVID-19 and liver damage, most significantly the drug tocilizumab.

We observed a strong association between the use of COVID-19 medications and abnormal liver tests, said Lim, but added that they could not confidently tease out that the abnormal tests were due to drug-induced liver injury as opposed to the disease.
explanation: The evidence highlights a strong association between abnormal liver tests and severe COVID-19 outcomes but does not support a strong link between abnormal liver tests and normal outcomes. Researchers also note difficulties in attributing abnormal liver tests solely to the disease, suggesting other factors like medications may contribute.

statement: The sars-cov-2 cytopathic effect is blocked with autophagy modulators
label: SUPPORTED
evidences: One Sentence Summary Blocking SARS-CoV-2 cytopathic effects with selective autophagy inhibitors underlying the clinical benefits of chloroquine and hydroxychloroquine.

While it is known that chloroquine and hydroxychloroquine, extensively explored as clinical agents for COVID-19, have multiple cellular effects including inhibiting autophagy, there are also dose- limiting toxicities in patients that make clearly establishing their potential mechanisms-of-action problematic.

Immunofluorescence staining for LC3B and LysoTracker dye staining assays in several cell lines indicated their potency and efficacy for inhibiting autophagy correlated with the measurements in the SARS-CoV-2 cytopathic effect assay.
explanation: The evidence indicates that selective autophagy inhibitors, including chloroquine and hydroxychloroquine, inhibited autophagy as observed through related assays, which correlated with the inhibition of SARS-CoV-2 cytopathic effects.

statement: Broad host range of sars-cov-2 predicted by comparative and structural analysis of ace2 in vertebrates
label: SUPPORTED
evidences: We identified a large number of mammals that can potentially be infected by SARS-CoV-2 via their ACE2 proteins.

To identify candidate intermediate host species and species at risk for SARS-CoV-2 infection, we undertook a deep comparative genomic, evolutionary, and structural analysis of ACE2, which serves as the SARS-CoV-2 receptor in humans.

Comparative analysis of ACE2 protein sequences can be used to predict their ability to bind SARS-CoV-2 S (2) and therefore may yield important insights into the biology and potential zoonotic transmission of SARS-CoV-2 infection.
explanation: The evidence indicates that a comparative and structural analysis of ACE2 in vertebrates was conducted, with results supporting that SARS-CoV-2 could potentially infect a broad range of mammals via their ACE2 proteins. This aligns with the core claim.

statement: Butantan vaccine reaches the final stage
label: SUPPORTED
evidences: By Dorah Feliciano \- November 24, 2020 Facebook Twitter Linkedin WhatsApp Email [uamad id="317182"] RIO DE JANEIRO, BRAZIL - The clinical trial of CoronaVac, the vaccine developed by the Butantan Institute in partnership with biopharmaceutical company Sinovac Life Science, has reached its final stage.

statement: Intranasal chadox1 ncov-19/azd1222 vaccination reduces shedding of sars-cov-2 d614g in rhesus macaques.
label: SUPPORTED

Here we investigate whether intranasally administered ChAdOx1 nCoV-19 reduces shedding, using a SARS-CoV-2 virus with the D614G mutation in the spike protein.

statement: Exhaled aerosol increases with covid-19 infection , and risk factors of disease symptom severity
label: SUPPORTED
evidences: In our observational cohort study of the exhaled breath particles of 74 healthy human subjects, and in our experimental infection study of eight nonhuman primates infected by aerosol with SARS- CoV-2, we found that exhaled aerosol particles increase one to three orders of magnitude with aging, high BMI, and COVID-19 infection.

We studied respiratory droplet generation and exhalation in human and nonhuman primate subjects with and without COVID-19 infection to explore whether SARS- CoV-2 infection, and other changes in physiological state, translates into observable evolution of numbers and sizes of exhaled respiratory droplets in healthy and diseased subjects.
explanation: The evidence explicitly states that exhaled aerosol particles increase one to three orders of magnitude with COVID-19 infection, aging, and high BMI. statement: Autopsies show varied forms of heart damage in covid-19 patients
label: SUPPORTED
evidences: Researchers had found, for example, that 8-12 percent of hospitalized COVID-19 patients had elevated levels of muscle contraction-regulating proteins called troponins--a sign of heart damage--and that these patients had an increased risk of mortality compared with those who didn't have excess troponins.

Early in the pandemic, other clinicians noted that even some patients who didn't have preexisting heart conditions experienced cardiovascular damage while fighting COVID-19 infections, pointing to a possible causative link.
But Stone says he was surprised to see just how common these were--18 out of 21 COVID-19 patients' hearts harbored macrophages that exhibited this type of inflammation.
explanation: The evidence indicates that various forms of heart damage were observed in COVID-19 patients, supported by elevated troponin levels, increased risk of mortality, cardiovascular damage in patients without preexisting heart conditions, and inflammation in the hearts of patients. These findings collectively support the claim.

statement: White house 's opening up america again guidelines
label: SUPPORTED
evidences: According to the White House, once these criteria are met, states and regions can begin returning to normal economic activity in three phases.
Titled "Opening Up America Again," the document lays out recommendations for easing stay-at-home restrictions for individuals, employers and organizations once a series of "gating criteria" are met.
Learn more about the guidelines at WhiteHouse.gov/OpeningAmerica.

This evening, President Trump continued his unprecedented level of access to the American people at a press conference where he presented his guidelines on the three phases of Opening Up America Again.

During a virtual leadership roundtable hosted by Meeting Professionals International, held during Virtual Global Meetings Industry Day  two days before the White House released the "Opening Up America Again" guidelines  U.S. Travel Association CEO Roger Dow described how he and other industry leaders have started discussing specific guidelines for events once gatherings are again allowed to take place.
explanation: The provided evidence aligns with the claim, referencing the guidelines titled 'Opening Up America Again' and describing their purpose, phases, and criteria as outlined by the White House. statement: Mva vector vaccines inhibit sars cov-2 replication in upper and lower respiratory tracts of transgenic mice and prevent lethal disease.
label: SUPPORTED
evidences: In a transgenic mouse model, one or two injections of recombinant MVAs that express modified forms of S inhibited CoV-2 replication in the upper and lower respiratory tracts and prevented severe disease.

A recent paper, that appeared as a preprint on the bioRxiv server in January 2021, shows the effectiveness of a novel recombinant vaccinia virus that expresses modified SARS-CoV-2 spike antigen, in preventing the replication of the virus in the respiratory tract of transgenic mice, and to prevent lethal disease.
The researchers found that serum from mice vaccinated with MVA that expressed wildtype S could be given intraperitoneally to transgenic hACE2-expressing mice, producing a high neutralizing titer.
Weight loss and lethality following intranasal infection of transgenic hACE2 mice with CoV-2 was prevented by one or two immunizations with rMVAs or by passive transfer of serum from vaccinated mice.
explanation: The evidence indicates that recombinant MVA vaccines expressing modified SARS-CoV-2 spike antigens inhibited virus replication in both upper and lower respiratory tracts of transgenic mice and prevented severe, lethal disease. The description aligns with the claim.

explanation: The evidence supports that recombinant MVA vaccines inhibit SARS-CoV-2 replication and prevent severe disease, but it does not support that they promote SARS-CoV-2 replication in the upper and lower respiratory tracts as claimed.

statement: Mva vector vaccines induce sars cov-2 replication in upper and lower respiratory tracts of transgenic mice and prevent lethal disease.
label: NOT_SUPPORTED
evidences: In a transgenic mouse model, one or two injections of recombinant MVAs that express modified forms of S inhibited CoV-2 replication in the upper and lower respiratory tracts and prevented severe disease.

A recent paper, that appeared as a preprint on the bioRxiv server in January 2021, shows the effectiveness of a novel recombinant vaccinia virus that expresses modified SARS-CoV-2 spike antigen, in preventing the replication of the virus in the respiratory tract of transgenic mice, and to prevent lethal disease.
The researchers found that serum from mice vaccinated with MVA that expressed wildtype S could be given intraperitoneally to transgenic hACE2-expressing mice, producing a high neutralizing titer.
Weight loss and lethality following intranasal infection of transgenic hACE2 mice with CoV-2 was prevented by one or two immunizations with rMVAs or by passive transfer of serum from vaccinated mice.
explanation: The evidence directly states that recombinant MVA vector vaccines expressing modified spike antigens inhibited SARS-CoV-2 replication in upper and lower respiratory tracts and prevented lethal disease in transgenic mice. This aligns with the claim.

statement: Sars-cov-2 orf6 hijacks nup98 to block stat nuclear import and antagonize interferon signaling
label: SUPPORTED
evidences: The Orf6-Nup98 interaction is critical to block STAT nuclear translocation and IFN signaling.
The Orf6-Nup98 interaction is critical to block STAT nuclear translocation and IFN signaling. Fig.
In this study, we show that SARS-CoV-2 is able to efficiently block STAT1 and STAT2 nuclear translocation in order to impair transcriptional induction of IFN-stimulated genes (ISGs).

We found that SARS-CoV-2 Orf6 localizes at the nuclear pore complex (NPC) and directly interacts with Nup98-Rae1 via its C-terminal domain to impair docking of cargo-receptor (karyopherin/importin) complex and disrupt nuclear import.
explanation: The evidence directly establishes that SARS-CoV-2 Orf6 interacts with Nup98 to block STAT nuclear translocation, which antagonizes interferon signaling. The mechanism involving the nuclear pore complex and importin disruption further supports the claim.

statement: Patients are coming in too late for treatment .
label: SUPPORTED
evidences: Late diagnosis can occur when a patient delays going to see a doctor about symptoms they have developed, or a doctor wrongly judges those signs to be of no concern or believes they indicate another illness, such as irritable bowel syndrome.
explanation: The evidence suggests that late diagnosis can happen because patients delay seeking medical attention, which supports the claim that patients are coming in too late for treatment.

statement: Patients are coming in too short for treatment.
label: NOT_SUPPORTED

explanation: The evidence provided does not mention anything about patients being physically too short for treatment. Instead, it discusses delayed diagnoses due to patient behavior or incorrect judgment by doctors, which is unrelated to the claim.

statement: Normally invisible saliva droplets can linger in the air , visualized by researchers using laser technology .
label: SUPPORTED
evidences: He runs a laser lab normally used to study protein structural dynamics, but was able to use that technology to investigate the hunch that normal speaking produces small droplets that can spread disease.

Whereas large droplets fall quickly to the ground, small droplets can dehydrate and linger as droplet nuclei in the air, where they behave like an aerosol and thereby expand the spatial extent of emitted infectious particles.2 We report the results of a laser light-scattering experiment in which speech-generated droplets and their trajectories were visualized.

Laser light is a common technique to visualize and count droplets in the air, says Alex Huffman, an associate professor who studies aerosols in the department of chemistry and biochemistry at the University of Denver.

Image Laser light scattering observations of droplets in the experimental setup.Credit...Valentyn Stadnytskyi; Philip Anfinrud; Christina E. Bax; Adriaan Bax The scientists also found that while droplets start shrinking from dehydration as soon as they leave a persons mouth, they can still float in the air for eight to 14 minutes.
explanation: The evidence confirms that laser technology was used to visualize saliva droplets and study their behavior, including lingering in the air. Multiple researchers and experiments are cited to support these findings.

statement: Sex differences in immune responses to sars-cov-2 that underlie disease outcomes
label: SUPPORTED
evidences: In this study, we examined sex differences in viral loads, SARS-CoV-2-specific antibody titers, plasma cytokines, as well as blood cell phenotyping in COVID-19 patients.
Conversely, higher innate immune cytokines in female patients associated with worse disease progression, but not in male patients.
In contrast, female patients mounted significantly more robust T cell activation than male patients during SARS-CoV-2 infection, which was sustained in old age.
explanation: The evidence explains sex differences in SARS-CoV-2 immune responses, such as higher cytokine levels in female patients being linked to worse outcomes, and stronger T cell activation in female patients compared to males. These differences support the claim that immune response differences underlie distinct disease outcomes between sexes.

statement: Adjuvant-free nanofiber vaccine induces in situ lung dendritic cell activation and th17 responses
label: SUPPORTED
evidences: These observations are congruent with the conclusion of independent priming by intranasal EαQ11 nanofibers of CD4+ T cells in the lung.
Thus, in the absence of exogenous adjuvants, intranasally administered nanofiber vaccines preferentially elicit robust antigen-specific TH17 responses that accumulated in both the LN and lung.

During primary immune responses elicited by pathogens such as Gram-negative bacteria, IL-17 at the lung mucosal surface is produced by natural killer (NK) cells, γδ T cells, and group 3 innate lymphoid cells (ILCs) [reviewed in ( 35)].
explanation: The evidence demonstrates that intranasally administered nanofiber vaccines, in the absence of exogenous adjuvants, elicit antigen-specific TH17 responses and activate components of the immune system in the lung. This supports the claim about the lung dendritic cell activation and TH17 response.

statement: Antibody testing will enhance the power and accuracy of covid-19-prevention trials
label: SUPPORTED
evidences: Knowing that someone seroconverts and becomes immune during the trial despite having no symptoms could, for instance, prove to be a more optimal outcome than simply preventing infection and the development of immunity altogether, as has been observed in some patients receiving chemoprophylaxis for influenza8.
Here we argue that serological testing of trial participants at the start and end of the trial (and perhaps at intermediate points) will enhance the value and interpretability of these studies.
explanation: The evidence suggests that serological testing (antibody testing) enhances the value and interpretability of covid-19-prevention trials, which aligns with the claim that it will improve their power and accuracy.

statement: Cytodyn reports strong results from eind covid-19 patients treated with leronlimab ; majority of patients have demonstrated remarkable recoveries
label: SUPPORTED
evidences: Bruce Patterson, M.D., Chief Executive Officer and founder of IncellDx, a diagnostics company and an advisor to CytoDyn, expanded on these findings by stating, We are excited that patients are responding extremely well to leronlimab as expected from the novel mechanism of COVID-19 pathogenesis we discovered and will be reporting in the coming days. Nader Pourhassan, Ph.D., President and Chief Executive Officer of CytoDyn said, We believe these results, although anecdotal, are very impressive and the number of patients treated under eIND is rapidly increasing.
All patient blood samples were evaluated and important powerful results from the effect of leronlimab were demonstrated in almost all of these patients.
explanation: The evidence provides positive comments about the response to leronlimab but describes the findings as anecdotal. The claim of 'remarkable recoveries' for the majority of patients is not substantiated with specific data or peer-reviewed results, leaving it unsupported.

statement: Sars-cov-2 infects brain choroid plexus and disrupts the blood-csf-barrier
label: SUPPORTED
evidences: We find that infected cells of the choroid plexus are an apolipoprotein and ACE2 expressing subset of epithelial barrier cells.

These findings suggest that neurological complications may result from effects on the choroid plexus, an important barrier that normally prevents entry of immune cells and cytokines into the cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) and brain.

We then challenge organoids with both SARS-CoV-2 spike protein pseudovirus and live virus to demonstrate high viral tropism for choroid plexus epithelial cells but not stromal cells, and little to no infection of neurons or glia.
Here, we use brain organoids to examine SARS-CoV-2 neurotropism.
Finally, we show that infection with live SARS-CoV-2 leads to barrier breakdown of the choroid plexus.
explanation: The evidence indicates that SARS-CoV-2 infects choroid plexus epithelial cells, demonstrates a high tropism for these cells, and causes barrier breakdown. This supports the claim that SARS-CoV-2 infects the brain choroid plexus and disrupts the blood-CSF barrier.

statement: Delaware medical supplier says fema seized 400,000 n95 masks , now he 's out millions of dollars
label: SUPPORTED
evidences: Citing Defense Production Act authority, the FEMA document further ordered Indutex to "set aside" all N95 or surgical masks it may come to possess during the federal emergency for a potential sale to FEMA.

George Gianforcaro, owner of the small, Newark, Delaware-based Indutex USA, said the Federal Emergency Management Agency did not pay him when it took possession of two imported shipments of masks bound for customers across the United States.
explanation: The evidence indicates that FEMA, citing Defense Production Act authority, instructed Indutex USA to 'set aside' masks during the federal emergency. Additionally, the company's owner stated that FEMA took possession of shipments without payment, which aligns with the claim about masks being seized and financial loss.

label: SUPPORTED

> Dr. Anthony Fauci says there could potentially be between 100,000 to 200,000 > deaths related to the coronavirus and millions of cases.
explanation: The evidence explicitly states that Dr. Anthony Fauci predicted between 100,000 to 200,000 deaths from the coronavirus in the U.S., which aligns closely with the claim. The modeling and pace of spread are mentioned as the basis for his prediction.

statement: Leronlimab used in seven patients in nyc with severe covid-19 demonstrated promise with two intubated patients in icu , removed from icu and extubated with reduced pulmonary inflammation
label: SUPPORTED
evidences: Our companion diagnostics showed that after three days of therapy, the immune profile in these patients approached normal levels and the levels of cytokines involved in the cytokine storm were much improved. Jacob Lalezari, M.D., Interim Chief Medical Officer of CytoDyn, commented, These preliminary results give hope that leronlimab may help hospitalized patients with COVID-19 recover from the pulmonary inflammation that drives mortality and the need for ventilators.
The treatment with leronlimab is targeted as a therapy for patients who experience respiratory complications as a result of contracting SARS-CoV-2 causing the Coronavirus Disease 2019 (COVID-19).

Moreover, a Phase 2b clinical trial demonstrated that leronlimab monotherapy can prevent viral escape in HIV-infected patients; some patients on leronlimab monotherapy have remained virally suppressed for more than five years.
Clinical results to date from multiple trials have shown that leronlimab can significantly reduce viral burden in people infected with HIV with no reported drug-related serious adverse events (SAEs).
explanation: While the evidence mentions preliminary results suggesting that leronlimab may help COVID-19 patients recover from pulmonary inflammation, it does not specifically document or confirm the outcomes of seven patients in NYC, nor does it detail the extubation and ICU removal of two intubated patients. The claim lacks direct evidence of these specific details.

statement: The sars-cov-2-like virus found in captive pangolins from guangdong should be better sequenced .
label: SUPPORTED
evidences: bioRxiv - Bioinformatics Pub Date : 2020-05-07 , DOI: 10.1101/2020.05.07.077016 Alexandre Hassanin Viruses closely related to SARS-CoV-2, which is the virus responsible of the Covid-19 pandemic, were sequenced in several Sunda pangolins ( Manis javanica ) seized in the Guangdong and Guangxi provinces of China between 2017 and 20191-3.
The GD/P2S dataset2 contains reads that are identical to SARS-CoV-2, suggesting either the coexistence of two SARS-CoV-2-like viruses in the same pangolin or contamination by the human virus.
To overcome this absence, I assembled these genomes from the Sequence Read Archive (SRA) data available for SARS- CoV-2-like viruses detected in five captive pangolins from Guangdong.
explanation: The evidence shows that SARS-CoV-2-like viruses were detected in captive pangolins from Guangdong, but the sequencing results suggest either contamination or coexistence of different viral strains. This indicates that better sequencing may be required to overcome uncertainties and provide more reliable data.

statement: The sars-cov-2-like virus found in captive pangolins from guangdong cannot be better sequenced.
label: NOT_SUPPORTED
evidences: bioRxiv - Bioinformatics Pub Date : 2020-05-07 , DOI: 10.1101/2020.05.07.077016 Alexandre Hassanin Viruses closely related to SARS-CoV-2, which is the virus responsible of the Covid-19 pandemic, were sequenced in several Sunda pangolins ( Manis javanica ) seized in the Guangdong and Guangxi provinces of China between 2017 and 20191-3.
The GD/P2S dataset2 contains reads that are identical to SARS-CoV-2, suggesting either the coexistence of two SARS-CoV-2-like viruses in the same pangolin or contamination by the human virus.
To overcome this absence, I assembled these genomes from the Sequence Read Archive (SRA) data available for SARS- CoV-2-like viruses detected in five captive pangolins from Guangdong.
explanation: The evidence does not demonstrate that the SARS-CoV-2-like virus found in captive pangolins from Guangdong cannot be better sequenced. Instead, it describes efforts to assemble genomes and indicates potential contamination issues or coexistence of viruses. This does not support the claim that better sequencing is impossible.

statement: Finding suggests technology can be installed in air conditioning , vacuum , and water systems
label: SUPPORTED
evidences: Eventually, as the science develops, the industry will be able to make the necessary adjustments and install the bulbs in robotic systems or air conditioning, vacuum, and water systems, and thereby be able to efficiently disinfect large surfaces and spaces.
Disinfection systems based on LED bulbs, however, can be installed in the ventilation system and air conditioner, for example, and sterilize the air sucked in and then emitted into the room.

In the future, the researchers will test their unique combination of integrated damage mechanisms and more ideas they recently developed on combined efficient direct and indirect damage to bacteria and viruses on different surfaces, air, and water.
explanation: The evidence supports the claim that technology can be installed in air conditioning, vacuum, and water systems. The texts mention the capability to install such technology in air conditioning, ventilation systems, and water systems for sterilization and disinfection purposes.

statement: The furin cleavage site of sars-cov-2 spike protein is a key determinant for transmission due to enhanced replication in airway cells .
label: SUPPORTED
evidences: Using lentiviral pseudotypes and a cell- culture adapted SARS-CoV-2 virus with a S1/S2 deletion, we show that the polybasic insertion is selected for in lung cells and primary human airway epithelial cultures but selected against in Vero E6, a cell line used for passaging SARS-CoV-2.
The furin cleavage site of SARS-CoV-2 spike protein is a key determinant for transmission
We find this selective advantage depends on expression of the cell surface protease, TMPRSS2, that allows virus entry independent of endosomes thus avoiding antiviral IFITM proteins.
SARS-CoV-2 has a unique polybasic insertion at the S1/S2 CS, which we demonstrate can be cleaved by furin.
explanation: The evidence supports the claim by showing that the furin cleavage site of the SARS-CoV-2 spike protein is a key determinant for transmission due to enhanced replication in airway cells. The evidence describes how the cleavage site is selected for in human airway epithelial cultures and mentions its role in enabling virus entry independent of endosomes via TMPRSS2.

statement: The furin cleavage site of sars-cov-2 spike protein is a key determinant for transmission due to enhanced infection in airway cells.
label: NOT_SUPPORTED
evidences: Using lentiviral pseudotypes and a cell- culture adapted SARS-CoV-2 virus with a S1/S2 deletion, we show that the polybasic insertion is selected for in lung cells and primary human airway epithelial cultures but selected against in Vero E6, a cell line used for passaging SARS-CoV-2.
The furin cleavage site of SARS-CoV-2 spike protein is a key determinant for transmission
We find this selective advantage depends on expression of the cell surface protease, TMPRSS2, that allows virus entry independent of endosomes thus avoiding antiviral IFITM proteins.
SARS-CoV-2 has a unique polybasic insertion at the S1/S2 CS, which we demonstrate can be cleaved by furin.
explanation: The evidence demonstrates that the furin cleavage site at the S1/S2 junction of the SARS-CoV-2 spike protein enhances infection in airway cells, supports transmission, and depends on protease TMPRSS2 expression for virus entry, aligning with the claim.

statement: Is there an airborne component to the transmission of covid-19 ?
label: SUPPORTED
evidences: Conclusions Given that live SARS-CoV-2 virions are known to be shed in high concentrations from the nasal cavity of both symptomatic and asymptomatic COVID-19 patients, the results suggest that those sharing enclosed spaces with infectors for long periods may be at risk of contracting COVID-19 by the aerosol route, even when practicing social distancing.

statement: Saliva-based antigen testing is better than the pcr swab
label: SUPPORTED
evidences: And, just as importantly, antigen-based testing is highly specific: unlike its PCR counterpart, the antigen test isnt fooled by faint signals of lingering viral matter outside the period of infectiousness.

Fortunately, other attributes of saliva-based antigen testing make this feasible: unlike PCR, it doesnt require trained personnel, specific chemical supplies, or centralized, expensive laboratory instrument; it is less vulnerable to the supply chain bottlenecks that plague PCR-based labs; it returns results in a matter of hours; it costs as little as $1 per test; and it could be as convenient as sucking on a piece of paper.

Rapid, saliva-based antigen testing is an essential weapon in the fight to resume many of the activities and reopen many of the venues that comprise what we used to call normal life. It is practical, convenient, cost-effective, and easily scaled.
explanation: The evidence outlines the practical advantages of saliva-based antigen testing compared to PCR swabs, such as convenience, cost-effectiveness, and scalability. However, it does not specifically address whether saliva-based antigen testing is 'better' than PCR swabs in terms of accuracy or reliability. The claim is therefore not fully supported by the evidence provided.

evidences: We identified new targets of the immune response to SARS-CoV-2 and show that nucleocapsid, open reading frame (ORF)8 and ORF3b elicit the strongest specific antibody responses.

We have identified ORF8 antibodies as a major marker of acute, convalescent and long-term antibody response to SARS-CoV-2 infection because of its immunodominance and specificity, in addition to N protein.
explanation: The evidence shows support for ORF8 antibodies as significant markers of acute, convalescent, and long-term response, which aligns with the claim about their accuracy as serological markers. evidences: Owermohle S. FDA says Pfizer vaccine vials hold extra doses, expanding supply.

Author: TEGNA Published: 6:03 PM PST December 16, 2020 Updated: 9:45 PM PST December 16, 2020 Pharmacists have discovered that many of the vials which are supposed to hold five doses of Pfizer's coronavirus vaccine have extra doses, multiple outlets are reporting.
FDA says extra doses from vials of Pfizer's COVID-19 vaccine can be used.
Reuters ; December 16, 2020. https://www.reuters.com/article/health-coronavirus-usa-pfizer/fda-says-extra-doses-from-vials-of-pfizers-covid-19-vaccine-can-be-used-idUSKBN28R050.
explanation: The evidence indicates that pharmacists discovered extra doses in vials of Pfizer's coronavirus vaccine, and the FDA confirmed that these extra doses could be used. Multiple sources report this information.

statement: Bradykinin initiates cytokine-mediated inflammatory hyperalgesia
label: SUPPORTED
evidences: These data show that bradykinin can initiate the cascade of cytokine release that mediates hyperalgesic responses to carrageenin and endotoxin (1 microgram).
Bradykinin release of TNF-alpha plays a key role in the development of inflammatory hyperalgesia.
explanation: The evidence explicitly states that bradykinin can initiate cytokine release, which mediates hyperalgesic responses, and that bradykinin release of TNF-alpha is crucial for the development of inflammatory hyperalgesia.

statement: Potently neutralizing human antibodies that block sars-cov-2 receptor binding and protect animals
label: SUPPORTED
evidences: From a panel of monoclonal antibodies (mAbs) targeting the spike (S) glycoprotein isolated from the B cells of infected subjects, we identified several mAbs that exhibited potent neutralizing activity with IC50 values as low as 0.9 or 15 ng/mL in pseudovirus or wild-type ( wt ) SARS-CoV-2 neutralization tests, respectively.
explanation: The evidence demonstrates the identification of monoclonal antibodies with potent neutralizing activity against SARS-CoV-2 but does not explicitly mention their ability to block receptor binding or protect animals. Additional evidence would be needed to fully support the claim.

However, further details or direct confirmation linking these three aspects specifically as 'hallmarks' of advanced pathology would increase confidence.

statement: The novel severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 directly decimates human spleens and lymph nodes

SARS-CoV-2 infection induces severe tissue damage including lymph follicle depletion, splenic nodule atrophy, histiocyte hyperplasia and lymphocyte reductions.
The novel severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2) directly decimates human spleens and lymph nodes.
explanation: The evidence directly states that SARS-CoV-2 causes severe tissue damage, including lymph follicle depletion, splenic nodule atrophy, histiocyte hyperplasia, and lymphocyte reductions, supporting the claim that the virus decimates human spleens and lymph nodes.

statement: Coronavirus vaccine shows promising early results in china
label: SUPPORTED
evidences: Lab research at CanSino Biologics in Tianjin, China, in 2018.Credit...China Stringer Network/Reuters By Apoorva Mandavilli Published May 22, 2020Updated July 16, 2020 A vaccine developed in China appears to be safe and may protect people from the new coronavirus, researchers reported on Friday.
A vaccine for the new coronavirus is considered to be the best long-term solution for allowing countries to reopen their economies and return to normalcy.
That vaccine has now entered mid-stage human trials, the manufacturer, Sinovac Biotech Ltd., said on Friday.
explanation: The evidence indicates that a coronavirus vaccine developed in China appears to be safe, may offer protection, and has entered mid-stage human trials, which aligns with the claim of showing promising early results.

statement: Sars-cov-2 reinfection in a cohort of 43,000 antibody-positive individuals followed for up to 35 weeks.
label: SUPPORTED
evidences: Results Among 43,044 anti-SARS-CoV-2 positive persons who were followed for a median of 16.3 weeks (range: 0-34.6), 314 individuals (0.7%) had at least one PCR positive swab 14 days after the first-positive antibody test.

Results: Among 43,044 anti-SARS-CoV-2 positive persons who were followed for a median of 16.3 weeks (range: 0-34.6), 314 individuals (0.7%) had at least one PCR positive swab 14 days after the first-positive antibody test.
explanation: The evidence provided mentions a cohort of 43,044 anti-SARS-CoV-2 positive individuals who were followed for a duration that includes up to 34.6 weeks. Additionally, 314 individuals were documented to have PCR-positive results, supporting the claim about reinfection in a cohort of 43,000 individuals followed for up to 35 weeks.

statement: Anakinra to prevent respiratory failure in covid-19
label: SUPPORTED
evidences: Conclusions Early suPAR-guided anakinra treatment is associated with decrease of the risk for SRF and restoration of the pro- /anti-inflammatory balance.
We investigated if early suPAR (soluble urokinase plasminogen activator receptor)-guided anakinra treatment could prevent COVID-19-assocated SRF.

Anakinra treatment was associated with decrease in SOFA score and in circulating interleukin (IL)-6, sCD163 and sIL2-R; the serum IL-10/IL-6 ratio on day 7 was inversely associated with the change in SOFA score.
explanation: The evidence indicates that early suPAR-guided anakinra treatment is associated with a decrease in the risk for COVID-19-associated respiratory failure (SRF) and markers of inflammation, suggesting its preventative potential.

statement: Hadassah doctors crack the cause of fatal corona blood clots
label: SUPPORTED
evidences: Hadassah researchers discovered that the patients who form these fatal clots have an increased level of alpha defensin protein in their blood, explained Dr. Abd Alrauf Higavi, who directs a lab at Hadassah and has been studying blood clots for 30 years.
The results show that alpha defensin speeds up blood clot formation, which can cause pulmonary embolism, heart attacks and stroke.
explanation: The claim is supported by the evidence, which describes how Hadassah researchers identified alpha defensin as contributing to fatal blood clot formation in corona patients. The evidence aligns with the claim directly.

explanation: The evidence discusses the discovery of elevated alpha defensin protein levels contributing to blood clot formation but does not explicitly mention the Hadassah virus as the cause of corona blood clots.

statement: Alpha-1 antitrypsin inhibits sars-cov-2 infection
label: SUPPORTED
evidences: Our findings show that endogenous α1-AT restricts SARS-CoV-2 and repurposes α1-AT-based drugs for COVID-19 therapy.

To identify factors of the respiratory tract that suppress SARS-CoV-2, we screened a peptide/protein library derived from bronchoalveolar lavage, and identified α1-antitrypsin (α1-AT) as specific inhibitor of SARS-CoV-2.
α1-AT targets the viral spike protein and blocks SARS-CoV-2 infection of human airway epithelium at physiological concentrations.
explanation: The evidence strongly supports the claim by showing that α1-antitrypsin inhibits SARS-CoV-2 infection through targeting the viral spike protein and blocking infection in human airway epithelium at physiological concentrations. Additionally, it mentions repurposing α1-AT-based drugs for COVID-19 therapy.

statement: New study suggests children may carry covid-19 at high levels
label: SUPPORTED

statement: Early transfusion of a large cohort of covid-19 patients with high titer anti-sars-cov-2 spike protein igg convalescent plasma confirms a signal of significantly decreased mortality
label: SUPPORTED
evidences: In the aggregate, the analysis confirms and extends our previous preliminary finding that transfusion of COVID-19 patients soon after hospitalization with high titer anti-spike protein RBD IgG present in convalescent plasma significantly reduces mortality.

Transfusion of convalescent plasma collected from donors who have recovered from COVID-19 disease has emerged as a promising therapy and has been granted emergency use authorization by the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA).
With respect to altering mortality, our analysis identified an optimal window of 44 hours post-hospitalization for transfusing COVID-19 patients with high titer convalescent plasma.

We recently reported results from interim analysis of a propensity-score matched study suggesting that early treatment of COVID-19 patients with convalescent plasma containing high titer anti-spike protein receptor binding domain (RBD) IgG significantly decreases mortality.
explanation: The evidence strongly supports the claim that early transfusion of COVID-19 patients with high-titer anti-sARS-CoV-2 spike protein IgG convalescent plasma significantly decreases mortality. The analysis confirms this finding, citing specific studies and results that demonstrate reduced mortality within an optimal treatment window.

statement: High sars-cov-2 viral load is associated with a worse clinical outcome of covid-19 disease
label: SUPPORTED
evidences: Here we report a statistically significant correlation between viral load and disease severity, being high viral load associated with worse clinical prognosis, independently of several previously identified risk factors such as age, sex, hypertension, cardiovascular disease, diabetes, obesity, and lung disease (asthma and chronic obstructive pulmonary disease).
The data presented here reinforce the viral load as a potential biomarker for predicting disease severity in SARS-CoV-2-infected patients.
It is also an important parameter in viral evolution since it relates to the numbers and types of variant genomes present in a viral population, a potential determinant of disease progression.
explanation: The evidence explicitly states a statistically significant correlation between high SARS-CoV-2 viral load and worse clinical outcomes, independently of factors such as age, sex, and comorbidities. This supports the claim with high confidence.

statement: Expert reaction to people being re-tested positive for coronavirus after initial recovery
label: SUPPORTED

She has a prolonged excretion of virus from her initial infection and tests were either not done or were not done sufficiently well or enough to confirm clearance.

Although coronaviruses generally cause short- term self-limiting infections which are cleared, there is some evidence in the scientific literature for persistent infections of animal coronaviruses (mainly in bats).

This highlights the need for more research into the biology of the new coronavirus, it is very much early days in our efforts to understand it. statement: Il-6 inhibition could be key to covid-19

explanation: The evidence shows that blocking the IL-6 signal transduction pathway has potential as a treatment for severe COVID-19, and Tocilizumab is highlighted as an effective IL-6 receptor blocker to address this. This suggests IL-6 inhibition could be key to treating COVID-19.

statement: Sars-cov1 frequent mask use in public venues , frequent hand washing , and disinfecting the living quarters were significant protective factors
label: SUPPORTED
evidences: In addition, frequent mask use in public venues, frequent hand washing, and disinfecting the living quarters were significant protective factors (OR 0.36 to 0.58).

The three public health variables--frequently wearing a mask in public places (adjusted OR = 0.36, p < 0.001), washing hands >10 times a day (adjusted OR = 0.44, p = 0.008), and disinfecting the living quarters thoroughly (adjusted OR = 0.36, p < 0.001)--remained significant protective factors.

A number of protective factors were related to relevant public health measures, including the frequency of using a face mask in public venues, the frequency of washing hands each day, and disinfection of living quarters thoroughly during the same period.

On the other hand, using a mask frequently in public places (OR = 0.27, p < 0.001), washing one's hands >10 times a day (OR = 0.58, p = 0.008), and disinfecting the living quarters thoroughly (OR = 0.41, p < 0.001) during the reference period were significant protective factors (Table 2).
explanation: The evidence clearly states that frequent mask use, frequent hand washing, and disinfecting living quarters were significant protective factors for SARS-CoV-1, supported by adjusted odds ratios and p-values indicating statistical significance.

statement: U.s. to suspend visa services in virus-hit countries including japan
label: SUPPORTED
evidences: (File photo) [Getty/Kyodo] Beginning Thursday, the U.S. Embassy in Tokyo and all consulates in Japan will suspend routine nonimmigrant visa appointments, while most services for U.S. citizens will continue.

The State Department decided to suspend visa services in "response to worldwide challenges related to the outbreak of COVID-19," with countries subject to travel advisories higher than level 1 set to be affected, the U.S. Embassy in South Korea said in a statement.
In South Korea, the U.S. embassy said it will cancel all routine immigrant and nonimmigrant visa appointments as of Thursday.
The travel advisory for Japan is at level 2, which calls for U.S. citizens to "exercise increased caution," while that for South Korea is at level 3, or "reconsider travel."
explanation: The evidence states that the U.S. Embassy in Tokyo and consulates in Japan will suspend routine nonimmigrant visa appointments as part of a broader response to COVID-19 challenges. Therefore, the claim is supported by the provided evidence.

statement: Chloroquine inhibits hmgb1 inflammatory signaling and protects mice from lethal sepsis
label: SUPPORTED
evidences: Chloroquine protects mice against lethal sepsis and inhibits HMGB1 release (A) The cecal Figure 3.
Here, we show that chloroquine, an anti-malarial drug, prevents lethality in mice with established endotoxemia or sepsis.
The protective effects of chloroquine were mediated through inhibition of HMGB1 release in macrophages, monocytes, and endothelial cells, thereby preventing its cytokine-like activities.
Chloroquine protects mice against lethal sepsis and inhibits HMGB1 release (A) The cecal ligation and puncture technique was used to induce intraabdominal sepsis in mice (n = 20 per group).
explanation: The evidence directly states that chloroquine protects mice from lethal sepsis and mediates its protective effects through the inhibition of HMGB1 release, which is a part of inflammatory signaling. This supports the claim effectively.

statement: Significant expression of furin and ace2 on oral epithelial cells may facilitate the efficiency of 2019-ncov entry
label: SUPPORTED
evidences: Conclusions Based on these findings, we speculated that 2019-nCov could effectively invade oral mucosal cells though two possible routes: binding to the ACE2 receptor and fusion with cell membrane activated by FURIN protease.
Our results indicated that oral mucosa tissues are susceptible to 2019-nCov, which provides valuable information for virus-prevention strategy in clinical care as well as daily life.

Results The bioinformatics results indicated the differential expression of ACE2 and FURIN on epithelial cells of different oral mucosal tissues and the proportion of FURIN-positive cells was obviously higher than that of ACE2-positive cells.

The S-glycoprotein, which recognized as the key factor for the entry of 2019-nCov into the cell, contains two functional domains: an ACE2 receptor binding domain and a second domain necessary for fusion of the coronavirus and cell membranes.
explanation: The evidence shows that ACE2 and FURIN are expressed in oral epithelial cells, facilitating susceptibility to 2019-nCov. Additionally, the S-glycoprotein of the virus interacts with ACE2 and is activated for membrane fusion by FURIN, further supporting the claim.

statement: High expression of angiotensin-converting enzyme-2 on tissue macrophages that may be targeted by virus sars-cov-2 in covid-19 patients
label: SUPPORTED
evidences: Consequently, this broad expression of ACE2 associated with TMPRSS2 and FURIN may explain the high pathogenic potential of SARS-CoV-2 described in some COVID-19 patients with severe multi-organ dysfunction.

These data indicate that alveolar macrophages, as the frontline immune cells, may be directly targeted by the SARS-CoV-2 infection and therefore need to be considered for the prevention and treatment of COVID-19.
To better understand the pathogenesis of COVID-19 and build up the host anti-viral immunity, we examined the levels of ACE2 expression on different types of immune cells including tissue macrophages.
Wong, S. K., Li, W., Moore, M. J., Choe, H. & Farzan, M. A 193-amino acid fragment of the SARS coronavirus S protein efficiently binds angiotensin- converting enzyme 2.
